bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 53 (Thursday, March 23, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SANTOS:H.R. 1736.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:US Constitution, Article 1 Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To prohibit the availability of funds to provide assistanceto foreign countries that criminalize or discriminate basedon sexual orientation, and for other purposes.[Page H1410]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Equality and Fiscal Accountability Protection Act of 2023

This bill prohibits expending federal funds to provide assistance to any country that has enacted laws that criminalize or discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, including laws that criminalize homosexuality or same-sex marriage.

bill.title: Equality and Fiscal Accountability Protection Act of 2023

item.title: Equality and Fiscal Accountability Protection Act of 2023
Equality and Fiscal Accountability Protection Act of 2023
To prohibit the availability of funds to provide assistance to foreign countries that criminalize or discriminate based on sexual orientation, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
